Below is a summary of people's opinions on the issue.

Overall summary of comments:

  • Predominant view: Roughly 70% oppose cutting academic funding, framing education as foundational to society and the economy. They warn of harm to students (especially low-income and adult learners), declines in educational quality and safety, reduced research capacity, slower innovation (e.g., medical breakthroughs), weakened long‑term competitiveness, and potential brain drain to other countries.
  • Minority perspectives: About 20% express mixed or conditional views—some see partial justification tied to perceived ideological bias in academia or trust that there may be a solution, but caution that cuts without viable alternatives risk degrading outcomes.
  • Uncertainty: Around 10% are unsure and request more details before forming an opinion.
  • Tone: Many comments are strongly critical of the policy; supporters are limited and largely qualified.

[Question]

What are your thoughts on Trump’s decision to cut academic funding?

answer.text_box: Universities betrayed their core duties to prepare students for a successful life, to give them a stable and balanced understanding of the world, and to foster innovation instead of indoctrination. 90% of the hate and bigotry in society is now driven directly by social revolutionaries in the academic world who actively teach students to reject fair-mindedness and personal responsibility; to judge everyone only by who they are instead of what they do; to replace morality with self-worship while glorifying crime and ter*orism; and infecting the objective sciences with a deluded form of sociology that makes modern university graduates destructive to any company or government that hires them. Universities and their students are by far the most undeservedly hyper-privileged people on Earth, sitting on billions in endowments they did little to earn while demanding funding from the same working people they teach their students to hate; and it is the universities, not Trump, who constantly silence and threaten their political enemies, while Trump justly prevents the theft of our taxes by privileged academic aristocrats who think they can steal money from the working class with no one's consent while giving the country nothing but poison and propaganda in return.
